newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian shares move higher on buoyant trade.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian shares move higher on buoyant trade.

text.p: Lithuanian shares halted three straight days of falls and moved higher on healthy activity, dealers said.
Overall central market volume was almost 3.5 million litas and the group A index rose by 71.52 points to 2,803.2.
Only a few banks were traded as dealers said that investors seemed to be waiting for the banks' final results before making any decisions.
Savings Bank rose 10 percent to 258.50 litas on trade of 647,000 litas while Hermis Bank rebounded after a sharp drop, rising to 237.10 litas from 215.60 litas on 158,000 litas.
Bloc trades worth almost 810,000 litas were made while the volume on the secondary T-bill was low at 10,500 litas.
Demand on the primary market remains high but falling yields have blocked interest in the secondary market, dealers said.
